title: US doctor who treated 10-year-old rape victim faces hearing
description: Doctor Caitlin Bernard faces possible discipline after the abortion she gave a child put her in the national spotlight.

title: US accuses Wagner Group of supplying missiles to Sudan’s RSF
description: Washington warns that the Russian mercenary group is prolonging the conflict and causing 'further chaos' in Sudan.

title: Sudan’s warring sides accuse each other of violating ceasefire
description: The truce between Sudan's army and the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces was reached after 5 weeks of warfare in Sudan.

title: Final Virgin Galactic test flight paves way for paying customers
description: Company celebrates as it completes what is likely the final test before commercial space tourism operations begin.

title: US releases plan to combat anti-Semitism amid definition debate
description: Biden administration stops short of officially adopting IHRA anti-Semitism definition favoured by pro-Israel groups.

title: Nvidia close to being first trillion-dollar chip firm on AI use
description: US company dominates market for chips used to power ChatGPT and similar services, a key reason behind its stock surge.

title: What are the root causes of modern-day slavery?
description: A report finds 50 million people globally are victims of forced unpaid labour.

title: ‘The war we know is better’: Palestinians leave Sudan for Gaza
description: Adel Atallah escaped the Israeli blockade of Gaza in 2007 to build a life in Sudan, only to flee conflict once again.

title: South Africa raises interest rates to 14-year high
description: Central bank decides on 10th straight hike as it raises its inflation forecast for year and blackouts plague country.

title: Oath Keepers leader Stewart Rhodes sentenced to 18 years
description: Sentence is the longest yet for a participant in the January 6 attack on the US Capitol, led by Donald Trump supporters.

title: Top US court curbs government regulations to protect wetlands
description: Supreme Court says wetlands can only be regulated if they have 'continuous surface connection' to another body of water.

title: Lebanon’s Druze leader Jumblatt resigns as political party chief
description: After stepping down at 73, Walid Jumblatt calls for elections to choose the Progressive Socialist Party's next leader.

title: Typhoon Mawar moves on but leaves many in Guam without power
description: No fatalities or major injuries reported in the aftermath of the heaviest storm to hit the US territory since 2002.

title: Pakistan minister defends trial of Khan supporters in army courts
description: 'They planned it': Defence Minister Asif alleges military installations in different cities were targeted deliberately.

title: What is the 14th Amendment and can it resolve US debt cap fight?
description: President Biden says he could invoke constitution to order the Treasury to issue bonds and keep paying gov't bills.

title: South Korea uses homegrown rocket to put satellite into orbit
description: KSLV-II Nuri is country's first domestically built space launch vehicle using only S Korean rocket technology.

title: Storm fells symbolic 400-year-old cotton tree in Sierra Leone
description: The tree was a symbol of freedom and had been a national landmark for centuries.

title: ‘Florida blueprint’: Key right-wing bills signed by Ron DeSantis
description: From immigration to guns to abortion, the presidential candidate pushed laws to advance conservative agenda in Florida.

title: Sixteen civilians face military trial in Pakistan over protests
description: Sixteen civilians to be tried in military courts in connection with the violence that followed former PM Khan's arrest.

title: Q&A: PFL boss on Ngannou, expansion and taking on the UFC
description: Chairman Donn Davis says the promotion will launch regional leagues in Africa and Middle East as part of global bid.

title: Middle East round-up: More fighting in Sudan, despite ceasefire
description: Here's a round-up of Al Jazeera's Middle East coverage this week.

title: Disbelief in Kenya over alleged Chinese cyberattack on gov’t data
description: A report on infiltration of gov't networks by Kenya's largest creditor has Kenyans asking how secure their systems are.

title: Puerto Williams: A journey to the end of the world
description: The globe's southernmost town is hoping to become a hub for biocultural and environmental education.

title: Russia signs deal to deploy tactical nuclear weapons in Belarus
description: Moscow says it will maintain control of the weapons, but Ukraine says Minsk has been 'taken hostage'.

title: Damage to Russian-occupied dam floods Ukrainian island community
description: Unrepaired damage at a Russian-occupied dam has submerged communities on islands along a reservoir in southern Ukraine.

title: ‘War crime’: Israel forcibly transfers Palestinian village
description: The 200 residents were forced to leave their land after years of Israeli settler and army violence.

title: Will Ukraine’s new weapons boost counterattacks against Russia?
description: Al Jazeera's Defence Editor Alex Gatopoulos on what lies ahead.

title: Deadly stabbing and shooting attack in Japan
description: Police have described the camouflage-clad attacker as a man wearing a hat, mask and sunglasses.

title: On China and Ukraine, does the G7 have the world’s support?
description: In the past, the G7 countries could make the rules, and most others would fall in line. We ask if those days are gone.

title: Solar investment outshines oil as race for clean energy heats up
description: High oil and gas prices and worries about supplies have seen spending on renewables leap ahead of fossil fuels.

title: Syrian babies abandoned in larger numbers as war grinds on
description: Babies are being left outside mosques, hospitals as the grinding conflict fuels poverty and desperation in Syria.

title: Japan says scrambled fighter jets after Russian planes spotted
description: Tokyo says Russian 'intelligence-gathering' aircraft spotted near its coasts along the Pacific Ocean and Sea of Japan.

title: Sunak under pressure as net migration to UK hits record 606,000
description: Sunak calls the number of people moving to the UK 'too high' after official data shows record net migration in 2022.

title: UN conference pledges fall short of $7bn goal for Horn of Africa
description: The 2.4bn raised was less than the $7bn the UN says is needed to provide help to millions at risk in the region.

title: New vaccine trials show promise in fight against meningitis
description: Phase-3 trials show NmCV-5 vaccine can illicit immune response against the five main strains of meningococcal bacteria.

title: Guinea’s suppression of protests stokes anger against military
description: Anti-government protests are gaining momentum in Guinea as frustrations with the interim military government increases.

title: Rwandan genocide fugitive Fulgence Kayishema arrested in S Africa
description: Kayishema, indicted by a UN tribunal on Rwanda in 2001, is alleged to have orchestrated the killing of some 2,000 Tutsi.

title: War comes home to Russia: Pro-Kyiv fighters seek Putin’s downfall
description: Russia has been jolted by one of the most daring incursions, allegedly carried out by groups including its nationals.

title: Prominent Algerian opposition activist arrested by authorities
description: Karim Tabbou, a prominent member of the Hirak movement, has been arrested several times since 2019.

title: Bangladesh promises free, fair polls after US warns of visa curbs
description: Dhaka assures free polls, due by January 2024, after US says it would restrict visas to Bangladeshis who undermine vote.

title: Paralysed man walks with device that connects brain, spinal cord
description: A paralysed man has regained the ability to walk smoothly using only his thoughts, for the first time.

title: Cambodia’s opposition disqualified from election, appeal fails
description: Cambodia’s Constitutional Council rejects appeal from opposition Candlelight Party to be allowed contest election.

title: Tunisia court frees radio station head arrested in crackdown
description: Several Mosaique FM journalists have been under scrutiny as Saied’s government cracks down on critics.

title: Why doesn’t Europe grieve deaths in the Mediterranean?
description: The uncomfortable reality is that to Europeans, not all lives are equal.

title: India’s opposition to boycott new parliament inauguration by Modi
description: Nineteen opposition parties announce boycott, accusing PM of sidelining Droupadi Murmu, India's first tribal president.

title: Dutch Caribbeans to sue Netherlands for climate crisis failure
description: A group of Bonaire residents threaten to sue the Dutch government for failing to protect the island from climate change.

title: Cambodia condemned after union leader jailed over casino strike
description: Chhim Sithar found guilty of 'incitement' over strikes that began in 2021 when NagaWorld fired more than 1,300 staff.

title: What is the new reality for migrants at the US southern border?
description: Human rights groups say tough new rules in wake of Title 42 expiration endanger people seeking asylum.

title: Treason trial set for Russian hypersonic missile scientist
description: Anatoly Maslov and two colleagues from Khristianovich Institute of Theoretical and Applied Mechanics accused of treason.

title: Gold for safe passage: How a family of 12 escaped from Sudan
description: Egypt seemed so close - but Raga Makawi and her relatives were stranded at the border for days after fleeing Khartoum.

title: Singapore economy beats estimates as government warns of risks
description: Southeast Asian city-state warns of rise in 'downside risks' amid rising interest rates, escalation of war in Ukraine.

title: ‘We want justice’: Anger in Uvalde a year after school shooting
description: Victims’ family members upset over lack of law enforcement accountability and progress on gun laws.In

title: Russia angered by visit to Norway of largest US aircraft carrier
description: The USS Gerald R Ford is visiting Oslo ahead of expected military exercises in the Arctic.

title: Microsoft says China-sponsored hackers targeted infrastructure
description: US tech giant says attacks targeted communications and other infrastructure in Guam and elsewhere.

title: Africa, don’t bite the poison pill of austerity any more
description: The continent's debt crisis is not of its making. And cutting back on public spending will only aggravate the problem.

title: ‘Raw, powerful, unstoppable’: Tributes pour in for Tina Turner
description: Barack Obama, Mick Jagger, Elton John and Beyonce pay tribute to 'Queen of Rock 'n' Roll' Tina Turner after her death.

title: Israel military court jails soldiers for abusing Palestinian man
description: Rights groups accuse Israeli military of investigating only a fraction of cases involving crimes against Palestinians.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 456
description: As the war enters its 456th day, we take a look at the main developments.

title: Russian leader of anti-Putin force says expect more border raids
description: Denis Kapustin, self-described leader of the Russian Volunteer Corps, said his unit will raid Russian territory again.

title: Wagner chief says 20,000 of its troops killed in Bakhmut battle
description: Yevgeny Prigozhin repeats criticism of Russia's top brass and warns high number of fatalities is a risk to the country.
